features: This heavy-duty corn broom is about 59.8", so you won't bend your back, the long broomstick will also allow you to reach every corner and spot, so you can keep your space spotless!
This heavy-duty corn broom has seven sews to create a stiffer broom for moving heavier debris, so it is good at collecting rubbish outdoor like your courtyard garage lobby mall market floor.
This heavy-duty corn broom has a protective jacket on its iron pole, it is soft, so you can hold it to sweep, and it will protect your hands when you sweep the floor.
The width of this heavy-duty corn broom part is about 13.4 inch long, so it can sweep a large area at a time, and it will also can help you save a lot of time and effort.

Our Yocada brand is registered and it has large factories to support, so if you encounter any problem while using the product, please feel free to contact our support team. We would sincerely serve you.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent Old Fashioned Broom!
reviews.reviewText: This broom is well made and bound tightly. There are no odd fly away pieces and it does an excellent job getting into all the cracks and crevices. I am highly satisfied with this seller and product!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 17, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The broom part does not remain attached to the handle when sweeping.
reviews.reviewText: Initially, this broom was what I hoped it would be, but after the return deadline it began to come apart when sweeping, after each brush sweep the broom part would become loose and if not tightened immediately the broom would detach itself from the stick part. In other words, I have to tighten after each stroke of the broom or the broom part falls off of the stick, imagine this when sweeping a large area, sweep then tighten.Although sturdy, easy to assemble, & durable it must be capable of doing the job it was created to do, and in order to do that it must remain in tact.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Broom In A Box!!
reviews.reviewText: The broom sections fasten together sturdily. I was pleasantly surprised by this product!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Forget the soft bristle brooms—get these
reviews.reviewText: The brooms with the soft, synthetic bristles miss the small bits like sand or potting soil, no matter how many times you go over the spot. Now I only buy these, and when friends complain about their soft brooms, I give them one, too. I use the standard and butler (smaller) size. They are great.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Want my money back baby
reviews.reviewText: Its sturdy but I had to duct tape the bottom part to keep it from coming undone. That isnt the bad part because its secure with the duct tape now. However the straw in the broom is packed really tight and it does not give while sweeping and it is just really rigid and does spread out to sweep adequately. Expensive but not worth it.. I have decided to use it outside only for sweeping away leaves. But inside it just wont sweep worth a damn. I'm gonna include a photo of how it looks now. It's about 8 months old.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Not bad ;NOT GREAT
reviews.reviewText: YOU CAN STILL FIND BETTER MADE BROOMS. THESE ARE OK NOT GREAT. NOTHING FEELS LIKE A WOODEN HANDLE AND BETTER QUALITY BRISTLES ARE AROUND AS WELL

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It swept me away
reviews.reviewText: I love the metal broomstick and the extra length. I plan on using them on my front porch and backyard patio. I

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Not a great broom
reviews.reviewText: I blame myself for not reading more carefully about this broom. The first surprise was when it arrived in a flat rectangular box. I didn’t realize the broom head and handle sections needed to be assembled. Once I had it together I was pleased with the weight and feel of the broom, but as other reviewers have noted, the corn straw head is very stiff. It has loosened up a little, but it’s biggest issue is that the straws break off or fall out while sweeping, so I end up cleaning up broom straws as well as the mess I’m trying to clean up! Pretty dang annoying. Also annoying is having to re-tighten the handle sections while sweeping, as the sweeping action causes them to loosen. I could try gluing the sections together, but I’m not sure I want to keep using the broom anyway.
